Class TextCompress

java.lang.Object
TextCompress
public class TextCompress
extends java.lang.Object
Main class of this program which allows the compression of text files using Huffman coding.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zagox11 (Student 690031300)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    (package private) static class  TextCompress.Node
    Represents the nodes of a Huffman tree.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static void compress​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename)
    Carries out the compression function of this program by checking that the provided filenames are valid, creating the output file, and then beginning compression of the input file's data, writing it to the output.
    private static void compressModified​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename, java.lang.String encodingSourceFilename)
    Carries out the modified compression function of this program by checking that the provided filenames are valid, creating the output file, generating the encoding from the provided encoding source file, and then beginning compression of the input file's data using it, writing the result to the output.
    private static void decompress​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename)
    Carries out the decompression function of this program by first checking that the provided filenames are valid and creating the output file.
    private static void encodeAndWrite​(java.io.File inputFile, java.io.File outputFile, java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> encodingMap)
    First, creates a LinkedHashMap from encodingMap with the key-value pairs flipped so that the compressed file can be decoded later, serialising it and writing the resulting bytes to the output file.
    private static void findHuffmanCodes​(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> encodingMap, TextCompress.Node node, java.lang.StringBuilder code)
    Recursively searches the provided Huffman tree, assigning each leaf node a binary codeword and entering the character-codeword pair into the given encodingMap.
    private static byte[] getBinary​(java.lang.String binaryString)
    Takes a string storing a sequence of binary digits and converts it into, and then returns, an array of bytes.
    private static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> getHuffmanEncoding​(java.io.File file, boolean modified)
    Generates the Huffman encoding, a LinkedHashMap of characters and their binary codewords, for the specified file and returns it.
    private static java.util.LinkedList<TextCompress.Node> getLeafNodes​(java.io.File file, boolean modified)
    Counts the frequency of all the characters in the input file and creates leaf nodes for them which each hold a character and it's count which is stored in the weight attribute.
    private static TextCompress.Node getNextNode​(java.util.Queue<TextCompress.Node> leafNodeQueue, java.util.Queue<TextCompress.Node> internalNodeQueue)
    Returns the next node to add into the Huffman tree which is the one that has the smallest weight attribute out of all nodes in leafNodeQueue and internalNodeQueue.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Main method where the program is run from.

  • Constructor Details

    • TextCompress

      public TextCompress()

  • Method Details

    • getLeafNodes

      private static java.util.LinkedList<TextCompress.Node> getLeafNodes​(java.io.File file, boolean modified) throws java.io.IOException
      Counts the frequency of all the characters in the input file and creates leaf nodes for them which each hold a character and it's count which is stored in the weight attribute.
      Parameters:
      file - input file to get characters and their weights from
      modified - true if modified compression is being used and forces the generation of a set of unicode character's leaf nodes, whether they are in the input or not, so that the resulting encoding can be used more universally across other datasets
      Returns:
      list of leaf nodes representing characters' frequencies
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • findHuffmanCodes

      private static void findHuffmanCodes​(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> encodingMap, TextCompress.Node node, java.lang.StringBuilder code)
      Recursively searches the provided Huffman tree, assigning each leaf node a binary codeword and entering the character-codeword pair into the given encodingMap. Defines each codeword based on the leaf node's position in the tree such that, from the root, each move to the left appends a 0 and each move to the right appends a 1.
      Parameters:
      encodingMap - encoding that stores mappings between characters and their assigned codewords
      node - the node to be checked
      code - the binary string that should be assigned as the codeword should this node be a leaf

    • getHuffmanEncoding

      private static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> getHuffmanEncoding​(java.io.File file, boolean modified) throws java.io.IOException
      Generates the Huffman encoding, a LinkedHashMap of characters and their binary codewords, for the specified file and returns it.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to generate the encoding for
      modified - if true, signals that the file being passed is not the one that the encoding will be used to compress and so a basic set of characters will always be included regardless of whether they are inside the passed file or not
      Returns:
      the Huffman encoding generated from the passed file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getNextNode

      private static TextCompress.Node getNextNode​(java.util.Queue<TextCompress.Node> leafNodeQueue, java.util.Queue<TextCompress.Node> internalNodeQueue)
      Returns the next node to add into the Huffman tree which is the one that has the smallest weight attribute out of all nodes in leafNodeQueue and internalNodeQueue.
      Parameters:
      leafNodeQueue - queue of leaf nodes which have yet to be attached to any other nodes in the Huffman tree
      internalNodeQueue - queue of nodes that don't represent characters and link to other nodes to the left and right in the Huffman tree
      Returns:
      the smallest node out of both leafNodeQueue and internalNodeQueue

    • getBinary

      private static byte[] getBinary​(java.lang.String binaryString)
      Takes a string storing a sequence of binary digits and converts it into, and then returns, an array of bytes. Deals with sequences that don't fit exactly into bytes by appending as many 0s to the end of the sequence as necessary to make the sequence divisible into 8-bit bytes before converting.
      Parameters:
      binaryString - the binary string to be converted
      Returns:
      a byte array with the order of bits preserved from binaryString

    • encodeAndWrite

      private static void encodeAndWrite​(java.io.File inputFile, java.io.File outputFile, java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> encodingMap) throws java.io.IOException
      First, creates a LinkedHashMap from encodingMap with the key-value pairs flipped so that the compressed file can be decoded later, serialising it and writing the resulting bytes to the output file. Next, reads and encodes the data from inputFile by replacing each character with its corresponding binary codeword from encodingMap.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - file to be compressed
      outputFile - file to write the flipped encoding map and encoded data to
      encodingMap - map that links characters to their binary string codewords
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • compress

      private static void compress​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Carries out the compression function of this program by checking that the provided filenames are valid, creating the output file, and then beginning compression of the input file's data, writing it to the output. This data is prepended by an encoding that is used by the decompression function of this program to decode the text again.
      Parameters:
      inputFilename - pathname of the input file which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      outputFilename - pathname of the output file to be created which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • compressModified

      private static void compressModified​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename, java.lang.String encodingSourceFilename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Carries out the modified compression function of this program by checking that the provided filenames are valid, creating the output file, generating the encoding from the provided encoding source file, and then beginning compression of the input file's data using it, writing the result to the output. This data is prepended by the encoding which is used by the decompression function of this program to decode the text again.
      Parameters:
      inputFilename - pathname of the input file which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      outputFilename - pathname of the output file to be created which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      encodingSourceFilename - pathname of the file to generate the Huffman encoding from which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • decompress

      private static void decompress​(java.lang.String inputFilename, java.lang.String outputFilename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Carries out the decompression function of this program by first checking that the provided filenames are valid and creating the output file. Then, reads through the compressed input file and decompresses the contents, writing the result to the output file. The encoding stored at the start of the input file is first deserialised and then used to find the characters that should be written to the output for each codeword in the input.
      Parameters:
      inputFilename - pathname of the compressed input file which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      outputFilename - pathname of the output file to be created that the decompressed data will be written to which can be either absolute or relative to the location of these program files
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method where the program is run from. Takes up to 4 argument strings from the standard input (passed when the program is called) which control how the application functions.
      Parameters:
      args - passed strings to control the program
